captions.text:
We've been
getting a lot of emails lately
and they all say one thing:

"Give us more
wolves in sheep's clothing."

So that's what we're doing.
There they are.

Three wolves,
each with a great sound.

I present:
Wolves in Sheep's Clothing Reloaded.
A real wolf in sheep's clothing is all about being underestimated.
What it's really capable of doesn't have to be obvious right away.

Our first candidate
is the Seat Leon Cupra R.
It's a real wolf in sheep's clothing,

because it looks
like a normal production car,
except maybe for the bigger rims.

But that's it. Other than that
it looks totally normal.

The nice thing about that
is there's 261 hp under the hood,

and when they kick in,
it's really a blast.
The little wolf
goes from 0 to 60 in just 6.1 seconds,
and doesn't stop till 155 mph.
The racer's insignias are discreet:
"Cupra" designated the sportier models in the series.
The little "R" takes it a step further.
This wolf pup is available for 31,000 euros.
Its features are extensive,
its interior functional,
and full of plastic.
But most importantly, it's got the kind of power you usually
only find in a sports car.
That's what Matthias is getting a taste of:
Never-ending power.
It has a wicked sound.
I don't think I've had so much fun...

... in a car with less than 295 hp.
Sorry!
Although you can't completely disable the ESC
and that's a drag.
When I take a corner,

the tail slides out and it kicks in,
although I'm countersteering a bit.

I should be able to slip much further
and decide when to countersteer.
Enough complaining .
It's time for the wolf in sheep's clothing mission.

The Cupra R
already looks like a sheep.
The tailpipe is pretty tame.

We just have to tape over
the insignias.
Now nobody will ever think
this car is sporty in any way.
So, let's jump on the autobahn.
Time to catch some prey.
Let's see if anybody's up to it.
I shouldn't go too fast.

I'll set the cruise control to 80
and get in the left lane.
Somebody's bound to bite.
Matthias is lying in ambush waiting for food.

Something's approaching
at a slightly elevated speed.

They flashed,
put on their left blinker.
C-Class station wagon.
I'll get out of his way.
I'll keep the Leon on a short leash.
Okay, hit the gas.

Show me what you've got.
He's got nothing!
Bye-bye.
The Seat Leon Cupra R
stripped off its sheep's clothing.
So, the C-Class is history.
Mission accomplished.
False. The first mission is accomplished.
Because Matthias just did so well against a "star"
now he gets to have a seat in an E-Class,
but right up front, because he's going to drive this taxi.
With 518 horsepower,
the E 63 AMG
uses its sportiness sparingly.
It's understated to perfection.
The 100,000 euro dream
has a formidable 465 lb·ft of torque.
It's got four driving modes so you can select
how much of a sheep this V8 wolf should be at a given time.

And this is candidate 2:
a grandpa car with a star.

It's grey to match
the hair of its driver.

But this one's different.
It says 6.3 up here.
And the rims are from AMG too.

And back here
is the Pièce de résistance:
E 63 AMG.

Any questions?
518 horsepower.
To Matthias's delight, the power goes straight to the rear axle.
Push it.

This E 63
is one heck of a drift machine.
The banshee has a max speed of 186 m hp,
and clears the way, screaming.

A bit of my lunch
just came back up when I screamed.
With this car...
... you can do...
... awesome, huge donuts.
It's sideways the whole time.

You can even do it one-handed,
while scratching your chin.
If required, the pilot has an armada of driver assistants at his disposal.
Like I said, if required.

Drifting is one thing,
but with this Mercedes,

you can take
a curve like this very precisely.
With just a slight drift.

Of course it drives a bit straighter
when the ESC is on,

because the 518 hp on the rear axle
needs to be kept in check.

A nice little
electronic helper like that

is probably a bit better
for certain drivers.
But what about
the most important question?
How tame can you make this muscleman appear to outsiders?
Is it understated?
It looks like a stuffy business limo.
You can't get any more understated.

We just have to
tape over a few things.

The 63 has
quite a few things to tape over.
We'll start with silver tape, of course.
Get rid of this AMG logo.
And the "63".
We'll cover the "E" up too.
Okay.
The tailpipes...
I can't remove them now.
But what I do have...
That's so awesome!

So I feel like a senior citizen too:
a beaded seat cover for the driver.

Nice and comfy,
and they massage a bit too.
And now to get really authentic.
On second thought...
Only the sound can blow Matthias's cover now.

It won't be easy to find decent rivals
for the Mercedes 63 AMG.

I mean, 518 hp
is nothing to shake a stick at.
But Matthias did disguise the wolf.
Now we'll see how good his disguise is.
So, I'm going 75

in the left lane,
where an E-Class likes to be.
And now the proof: someone challenges him.
The disguise is a success.
I'll let you pass.
The challenger:
a Saab 95 Aero. At least it's got more than 197 hp.
But how much horsepower does the E 63 again?
That's right: 518 hp.
Matthias blew the powerful wagon away.
He underestimated the E-Class big time.
It definitely passed the test.
The E-Class is totally understated.

If you tape over the "E 63"
and the AMG logo
nobody knows what it is.

That was very nice, and a lot of fun.
But it's about to get even better.

We've got one more, and it's got
as much HP as those two combined.
A monster crafted from carbon and aluminum,
with the power of 697 horses.
Here it is:

A BMW M3 by Manhart Racing
with a V8.
Nice carbon tailgate.

Okay, the color
isn't that inconspicuous,

but under here
lies a big heart with lots of power.
So, let's get this baby
onto the track.
697 horsepower.
max speed: 211 mph.
From 0 to 60 in 3.3 seconds.
Too many numbers for you?
Then take a listen to this.
I think I just came.
In the chest of Manhart M3 V8 bi-turbo
beats the engine of the X6 M.
A few adjustments to the ECU
and the ultimate wolf in sheep's clothing is complete.
Okay, the Manhart isn't that understated,
but nobody would ever guess it's got nearly 700 hp.

All that power goes to the rear axle.
No all-wheel drive.

It sounds to me
like this car could really drift.
We're going 60 mph,

and now I'm going to tap the gas.
Let's see what happens.
This happens.
And remember, he only tapped the gas pedal.

You floor it and nothing moves
but the speedometer.

We're going 50,
and I'm going to floor it.
Well okay,
the rear axle moved.
Bad boy.
We're already at 111 mph.

Were you counting?
I think it was about 5 seconds.

145, 150.
It's totally unspectacular.
You don't hear the engine at all.
The engine is extremely reserved.
We're already going 180.

The motor is very reserved,
but the speedometer goes:
But can Matthias put sheep's clothes on this Manhart?
So, now to disguise the Manhart.
Although...

I don't think
I have enough black tape.
I'll just find a worthy rival.
Matthias's rivals on the autobahn
only saw the M3 from behind.

My veins are still full of adrenaline
from back at the airfield.
Now it's time...

to have some fun
with some tough rivals, I hope.
Matthias's wish is granted not even a minute later.
Oh, what have we here?

A Porsche
and it's flashing its headlights.
A GT3 RS with 444 horsepower.
But little does the driver know: the M3 has almost 257 hp
more than that.
Hello, gentlemen.

Did you get yourselves
444 horsepower?
That's not enough.
Wanna go?
The Porsche boys are probably calling their dealership right about now.
Taken to school by the M3?
Impossible!
Wolves in Sheep's Clothing Reloaded makes it possible.
And who knows,
maybe Matthias will appear in front of your car soon too.
